children.name: the Olympics
children.definition: / the Olympic Games a set of international sports competitions that happen once every four years: thế vận hội
examples: The Olympic Games are held in a different country on each occasion.
the Summer/Winter Olympics
the Special Olympicsa set of international sports competitions for people who have lower than usual mental or physical abilities thế vận hội đặc biệt
Olympic[attri] of or relating to the Olympics
the International Olympic Committee
an Olympic gold medallist
Olympian[ C ] mainly US a competitor in the Olympic Games

children.name: the Paralympics
children.definition: / the Paralympic Games an international sports competition for people with physical disabilities, which happens every four years
examples: Paralympian[adj] relating to the Paralympic Games
Paralympian[C] sb who competes in the Paralympic Games

children.name: play
children.definition: to take part in a game or sport - use this especially about games in which you try to win against another person or team: tham gia ,chơi
examples: Karl loves basketball and plays almost every weekend.
Every Sunday we play Monopoly or some other board game.

children.name: play in
examples: I’m playing in a tennis match this Sunday.

children.name: play football/tennis/golf/baseball etc
examples: It’s been a long time since I played hockey.

children.name: do
children.definition: especiallyspokenuse this especially when talking about sports that arenotteamsports:

children.name: tập luyện, chơi (môn thể thao không phải đồng đội)
examples: I do aerobics twice a week.
He used to do karate when he was in college.

children.name: go
children.definition: use this about sports whose names end in ‘-ing’: chơi , đi

children.name: go climbing/swimming/running/riding etc
examples: John goes running every morning.
Make sure whoever you go climbing with is a safe and trustworthy partner.

children.name: sport
children.definition: UK /sports US physical activities that need effort and skill and that are usually competitive: thể thao (nói chung)
examples: He picked up the newspaper and turned to the sports pages.
Why is there so much sport on TV?
I always hated sport at school.
Today’s kids need to spend less time watching television, and more time playing sports.

children.name: play sport
examples: UK/ play sportsespecially USMy ambition was to play sport at the highest level.

children.name: do sport
examples: UK,do sportsUS I did a lot of sport at school.We don’t do much sport at my school.

children.name: competitive sport
children.definition: s
examples: (= in which people compete and try to win)Competitive sport teaches valuable lessons which last for life.

children.name: professional sport
children.definition: s
examples: (= which people are paid to do)The kind of money involved in professional sport makes cheating inevitable.

children.name: sport
children.definition: a physical activity in which people or teams play, race etc against each other and try to win: môn thể thao
examples: His favourite sports are swimming and tennis.
Motorcycle racing can be a dangerous sport.
My favourite sports are tennis and swimming.
All students are encouraged to take part in a sport.
field sportsUKsports that happen in the countryside, such as hunting, shooting, and fishing:các môn thể thao ngoài trời
blood sport[C usually P] any sport that involves animals being killed or hurt to make the people watching or taking part feel excitement : môn thể thao đẫm máu
winter sportssports that are done on snow or ice : các môn thể thao mùa đông
water sportssports which take place on or in water các môn thể thao dưới nước
Popular water sports include swimming, surfing and water-skiing.

children.name: a team sport
examples: I liked playing team sports such as football and rugby.

children.name: an individual sport
examples: You have to be mentally tough to compete in individual sports.

children.name: a spectator sport
children.definition: one that people enjoy watching
examples: Football is the most popular spectator sport.

children.name: a contact sport
children.definition: one in which players have physical contact with each other
examples: môn thể thao đối khángPeople get hurt in contact sports, but they also have fun.

children.name: an extreme sport
children.definition: one that is dangerous
examples: môn thể thao nguy hiểmMany teenagers are attracted to extreme sports such as snowboarding.

children.name: a winter sport
children.definition: skiing, ice skating etc
examples: More and more people are taking up winter sports.

children.name: a minority sport
children.definition: one that very few people do
examples: Minority sports rarely feature on TV.

children.name: take up a sport
children.definition: start doing it
examples: I took up the sport six years ago.

children.name: compete in a sport
children.definition: do that sport in competitions
examples: She competed in various sports when she was young.

children.name: take part in a sport
examples: Students are encouraged to take part in a sport of some kind.

children.name: play a sport
examples: Which sports do you play at school?

children.name: do a sport
examples: I think everyone should do at least one sport, in order to keep fit.

children.name: game
children.definition: an activity or sport in which people compete with each other according to agreed rules: trò chơi
examples: We used to love playing games like chess or backgammon.
Rugby is a very exciting, fast-moving game.
the game of football/basketball/tennis
The game of golf was invented in Scotland.
Chadwick suggested that baseball evolved from the English game of rounders.
The children played a gameofcops and robbers.
do/play games
The girls at King Edward’s play all sorts of games - basketball, hockey, tennis, to name just a few.
We used to love playing games like chess or backgammon.
a board/ball gameboard games such as Monopoly and Scrabble
the national gamethe most popular game in a country
In Wales, rugby is the national game.

children.name: play a game
examples: They explained how to play the game.

children.name: have a game
examples: British English They were having a game of pool.

children.name: a computer/video game
examples: He was up all night playing computer games.

children.name: a card game
examples: Bridge is a card game for four people.

children.name: a team game
examples: I wasn't very good at team games when I was at school.

children.name: a party game
examples: What's your favourite party game?

children.name: a league game
children.definition: played as part of a league competition
examples: There's a big league game against Chelsea on Saturday.

children.name: a cup game
children.definition: played as part of a cup competition
examples: He hopes to play in the cup game on Wednesday.

children.name: a playoff gameAmerican English
children.definition: one of a series of games played by the best teams in a competition to decide the final winner
examples: This is the first of their five playoff games.

children.name: a play-off gameBritish English
children.definition: played to decide the winner after a previous game ended with both teams having equal points

children.name: an indoor game
examples: There is a hall for indoor games and social functions.

children.name: an outdoor game
examples: Outdoor games are affected by the weather.

children.name: the rules of the game
examples: It's against the rules of the game to pick up the ball.

children.name: sports
children.definition: relating to sportthuộc thể thao
examples: Here is a list of the sports clubs in your area.
Heavy rain has flooded the sports field: all fixtures have been cancelled for a month.

children.name: a sports team
examples: A lot of schools have their own sports teams.

children.name: a sports club
examples: She joined her local sports club.

children.name: a sports field/ground
examples: The village has its own sports field.

children.name: a sports event
examples: Is this country able to stage a major sports event?

children.name: a sports fan
children.definition: someone who enjoys watching sport
examples: He was a big sports fan.

children.name: a sports personality
children.definition: someone who is famous for playing sport
examples: The event will be opened by a well-known sports personality.

children.name: a sports injury
examples: The clinic specializes in treating sports injuries.

children.name: sports facilities
examples: All our holiday camps have wonderful sports facilities.

children.name: sports equipmenta new online store selling all kinds of sports equipment
sporting
children.definition: relating to sports: thuộc thể thao
examples: sporting activities/events/facilities etc
The Olympics is the biggest sportingeventin the world.
The Italian Grand Prix is one of the great sporting events of the year.
The hotel has four restaurants, a bar and a disco, as well as an impressive range of sporting facilities.
The college offers a wide range of sporting activities.
one of the majorsporting eventsof the year
a great sporting achievement
Britain’s sporting heroes
sporting goodsUS
a sporting goods store

children.name: sporty
children.definition: describes sb who enjoys sport and is good at it: năng động, yêu thể thao
examples: Guy wasn't really the sporty type.

children.name: athletic
children.definition: physically strong and good at sport:
examples: a tall athletic man

children.name: penalty
children.definition: a disadvantage in sports given to a player or team for breaking a rule: lỗi
examples: Woodson received a penalty.

children.name: footwork
children.definition: skilful use of your feet when playing a sport

children.name: good/neat/fancy etc footwork
examples: The England keeper revealed some fancy footwork in the victory over Nottingham Forest.
And that's a marvellous bit of footwork there from Ponti as he takes the ball from Garcia.

children.name: transfer
children.definition: to change to a different team or to make sb do this: chuyển nhượng
examples: He was transferred for a fee of £8 million.
transfer[C] a player who has moved from one sports team to another : cầu thủ mới chuyển nhượng
They've a new transferfromTottenham playing for them.

children.name: transfer to
examples: Some very high-profile British players have transferredtoclubs abroad.
He threatened to give up football if his club didn't transfer him (= sell him to another team) .

children.name: on the bench
children.definition: acting as one of the possible substitutes in a sports match: ngồi trên ghế dự bị

children.name: Robson will again be on the bench
examples: He was injured, and spent the last few weeks of the seasononthe bench.

children.name: run-up
children.definition: in some sports, a run-up is a period or distance of running that you do in order to be going fast enough to perform a particular action: thời gian lấy đà/ khoảng cách lấy đà
examples: The longer and faster your run-up is, the higher you can jump.
